intro: Dalechampia sellowiana var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires specific care to flourish.
